lustre/tests/utime.c

00030 /*
00031  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00032  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00033  *
00034  * lustre/tests/utime.c
00035  *
00036  * Simple test for validating mtime on a file create and set via utime.
00037  */
00038 
00039 #include <stdio.h>
00040 #include <stdlib.h>
00041 #include <sys/types.h>
00042 #include <sys/stat.h>
00043 #include <fcntl.h>
00044 #include <unistd.h>
00045 #include <time.h>
00046 #include <string.h>
00047 #include <utime.h>
00048 #include <errno.h>
00049 
00050 void usage(char *prog)
00051 {
00052         fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <filename> [-s <filename>]\n", prog);
00053         exit(1);
00054 }
00055 
00056 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00057 {
00058         long before_mknod, after_mknod;
00059         const char *prog = argv[0];
00060         const char *filename = argv[1];
00061         char *secname = NULL;
00062         struct utimbuf utb;
00063         struct stat st, st2;
00064         int rc;
00065         int c;
00066 
00067         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "s:")) != -1) {
00068                 switch(c) {
00069                 case 's':
00070                         secname = optarg;
00071                         break;
00072                 default:
00073                         usage(argv[0]);
00074                 }
00075         }
00076         if (optind + 1 > argc)
00077                 usage(argv[0]);
00078 
00079         /* Adjust the before time back one second, because the kernel's
00080          * CURRENT_TIME (lockless clock reading, used to set inode times)
00081          * may drift against the do_gettimeofday() time (TSC-corrected and
00082          * locked clock reading, used to return timestamps to user space).
00083          * This means that the mknod time could be a second older than the
00084          * before time, even for a local filesystem such as ext3.
00085          */
00086         before_mknod = time(0) - 1;
00087         rc = mknod(filename, 0700, S_IFREG);
00088         after_mknod = time(0);
00089         if (rc && errno != EEXIST) {
00090                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: mknod(%s) failed: rc %d: %s\n",
00091                         prog, filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00092                 return 2;
00093         } else if (!rc) {
00094                 rc = stat(filename, &st);
00095                 if (rc) {
00096                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: stat(%s) failed: rc %d: %s\n",
00097                                 prog, filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00098                         return 3;
00099                 }
00100 
00101                 if (st.st_mtime < before_mknod || st.st_mtime > after_mknod) {
00102                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad mknod(%s) times %lu <= %lu <= "
00103                                 "%lu false\n", prog, filename, before_mknod,
00104                                 st.st_mtime, after_mknod);
00105                         return 4;
00106                 }
00107 
00108                 printf("%s: good mknod times %lu%s <= %lu <= %lu for %s\n",
00109                        prog, before_mknod, before_mknod == st.st_mtime ? "*":"",
00110                        st.st_mtime, after_mknod, filename);
00111 
00112                 if (secname) {
00113                         sleep(1);
00114                         rc = stat(secname, &st2);
00115                         if (rc) {
00116                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: stat(%s) failed: rc %d: "
00117                                         "%s\n", prog, secname, errno,
00118                                         strerror(errno));
00119                                 return 5;
00120                         }
00121 
00122                         if (st2.st_mtime < before_mknod || 
00123                             st2.st_mtime > after_mknod) {
00124                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad mknod(%s) times %lu "
00125                                         " <= %lu <= %lu false\n", prog,
00126                                         filename, before_mknod, st2.st_mtime,
00127                                         after_mknod);
00128                                 return 6;
00129                         }
00130 
00131                         printf("%s: good mknod times %lu%s <= %lu <= %lu "
00132                                "for %s\n", prog, before_mknod, 
00133                                before_mknod == st.st_mtime ? "*":"", 
00134                                st2.st_mtime, after_mknod, secname);
00135                 }
00136         }
00137 
00138         utb.actime = 200000;
00139         utb.modtime = 100000;
00140         rc = utime(filename, &utb);
00141         if (rc) {
00142                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: utime(%s) failed: rc %d: %s\n",
00143                         prog, filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00144                 return 7;
00145         }
00146         
00147         rc = stat(filename, &st);
00148         if (rc) {
00149                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: second stat(%s) failed: rc %d: %s\n",
00150                         prog, filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00151                 return 8;
00152         }
00153 
00154         if (st.st_mtime != utb.modtime ) {
00155                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad utime mtime(%s) %lu should be %lu\n",
00156                         prog, filename, st.st_mtime, utb.modtime);
00157                 return 9;
00158         }
00159 
00160         if (st.st_atime != utb.actime ) {
00161                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad utime atime(%s) %lu should be %lu\n",
00162                         prog, filename, st.st_atime, utb.actime);
00163                 return 10;
00164         }
00165 
00166         printf("%s: good utime mtimes %lu, atime %lu\n",
00167                prog, utb.modtime, utb.actime);
00168 
00169         if (secname == NULL)
00170                 return 0;
00171         
00172         /* Checking that times in past get updated on another client. */
00173         rc = stat(secname, &st2);
00174         if (rc) {
00175                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: second stat(%s) failed: rc %d: %s\n",
00176                         prog, secname, errno, strerror(errno));
00177                 return 12;
00178         }
00179 
00180         if (st2.st_mtime != st.st_mtime) {
00181                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: not synced mtime(%s) between clients: "
00182                         "%lu should be %lu\n", prog, secname,
00183                         st2.st_mtime, st.st_mtime);
00184                 return 13;
00185         }
00186 
00187         if (st2.st_ctime != st.st_ctime) {
00188                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: not synced ctime(%s) between clients: "
00189                         "%lu should be %lu\n", prog, secname,
00190                         st2.st_ctime, st.st_ctime);
00191                 return 14;
00192         }
00193         
00194         printf("%s: updated times for %s\n", prog, secname);
00195         
00196         return 0;
00197 }
